PrimEcoSys: Madrean Upper Montane Conifer-Oak Forest and Woodland

habitat_description:
This species occurs in southeastern Arizana through southwestern New Mexico. A mountainous lizard found in the Chiricahua, Peloncillo, Guadalupe, and Animas mountains, also Sierra Madre Occidental into southern Chihuahua, Mexico (Stebbins 2003). In Arizona, this species is only found in the Peloncillo and Chiricahua mountains. The striped plateau lizard occupies Madrean evergreen woodland and Petran montane conifer forest (Brennan and Holycross 2009). An inhabitant of forests of Apache and Ponderosa pine, and other mixed conifers. A montane endemic species known only from the Peloncillo and Chiricahua mountains, as mentioned before, but also found in the Animas mountains of New Mexico and Arizona. This species is known in the Sierra Madre Occidental of Sonora and Chihuahua, while the southernmost occupied areas are poorly known (Jones and Lovich 2009).

Mixed pine and oak woods. Typically found near rocks, logs, leaf litter, in areas with scattered grasses near intermittent streams (Degenhardt et al. 1996, Stebbins 2003).
